sources.data_found: Social Sciences HPC Cluster: Total compute nodes: 5; Total GPU nodes: 1; Total GPUs: 6 (includes compute node GPUs: 5x GeForce RTX 2080, GPU node GPUs: 2x NVIDIA A40)
UCLA Health HPC: Specialized Hardware includes support for GPUs (NVIDIA T4, A100) and FPGAs (Xilinx U250), ideal for deep learning, AI training, large-scale simulations
Hoffman2 Cluster: Several nodes have one or more GPU cards with computing capability ranging from 4 to 9
GPU nodes: A100 cards need to be explicitly requested; nodes with A100 cards have 80GB of memory; GPU nodes have multiple GPU cards; V100 and other GPU types available
Enrollment 2025–2026 Undergraduates: 4,142 Graduate students: 2,501; Seven Academic Departments including Computer Science
Computer Science majors doubled from 2001 to 2018; enrollment in Computer Science Department grown dramatically with percent of CS/CSE majors within HSSEAS rising from 13.7% in 2013 to 21.0% in 2016
MCSC (MS program in the Computer Science Department) had over 4000 applications and 150 offers were made

student_data.notes: CS undergrad count estimated from: Samueli total undergrads (4,142) × 21% CS/CSE proportion = ~870. MS count based on CS department reporting 150 offers made for MS program, assuming near 100% yield. PhD count estimated from Samueli graduate students (2,501) with CS department likely having ~15% of engineering graduate students = ~375 PhD students.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: UCLA Health HPC cluster includes NVIDIA T4 GPUs for AI/ML workloads
Social Sciences HPC compute nodes each have 1x GeForce RTX 2080

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS INCLUDED:

1) Hoffman2 (Main UCLA HPC): Primary cluster with GPU nodes having multiple cards. Based on documentation mentioning A100 (80GB) and V100 availability, estimated 20x A100 80GB and 30x V100 GPUs across multiple nodes.

2) UCLA Health HPC: Includes NVIDIA T4 and A100 GPUs for specialized healthcare AI/ML workloads. T4 count estimated at 10 GPUs.

3) Social Sciences HPC (SSHPCC): 5 compute nodes with 1x RTX 2080 each + 1 GPU node with 2x A40 = 5 RTX 2080 + 2 A40 total.

Note: Exact GPU counts for Hoffman2 cluster not publicly enumerated. Conservative estimates based on typical university HPC deployments with mentioned GPU types.

analysis_notes: Data collection reveals UCLA operates multiple HPC clusters across departments. Main Hoffman2 cluster documentation does not publicly enumerate exact GPU counts, requiring estimation. Social Sciences cluster provides most detailed specifications. Student enrollment estimated from engineering school totals with CS department proportions.
